data:
Reds in the Community (RITC) the charitable arm of Barnsley Football Club, who deliver sports activities to UK-based groups particularly to those considered disadvantaged by socio-economical circumstance are to engage in a European mobility.  It has sought a Maltese sports provider, Luxol Sport Foundation, who share similar organisational goals, to participate in a social inclusion programme for its target audiences. Twenty-six BTEC Sports Diploma students, mostly residing within the boundaries of a district within the lower quartile of deprivation, will participate in a two-week project that aims to engage Malta's refugee communities in meaningful and purposeful sporting activities. The  mobility project titled "Reds in the Maltese Communities" will see students use their educational training and practical experiences to plan and deliver sports activities at Luxol Sport Foundation's high profile facilities. The students currently studying at Barnsley FC will be accompanied and supported whilst in Malat by Luxol Sports Foundation sports professionals, as they work through their placement period. 
The students will follow and complete their training module whilst in Malta and this will be validated by sports professionals in addition to being presented with official Europass Mobility Documents to acknowledge their achievements. The mobility visit will also allow students to bring and present a number of RITC social inclusion activities that seeks to engage other disadvantaged groups in healthy sporting activities. Students will also gain a cultural experience and increase their Global outlook, visits to the key Maltese landmarks and building of significance will included in the mobility period and will inform students of Malta's extraordinary historical past and its long association with UK. Exposure to new settings, environments and language and planning and delivering activities to new audiences will present challenges, although students will have overcome a number of barriers in entering the project and will increase their life-skills throughout this mobility experience.
The short-term gains will see students returning from the training placement with much more improved confidence and self-achievement, increased accreditation and qualification and a student more aware on global issues. RITC will be able to develop their curriculum design so as to widen student experience in mobility activities, increase CPD that extends to Internationalisation and develop partnership working with companies abroad to increase mobility employment opportunities.
